page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: This is a story of decline and change. The staple employment of the area was and is farming, but the number of men, women and children employed now is no-where what it used to be. The number of farms have declined as farms have been bought up. The original farm houses and many farm cottages are empty or have been sold to commuters or the retired. The Church is in decline. The Vicar of the Church disappeared a long time ago and a succession of Priests in Charge have cared for it. It has been linked, and unlinked, with a series of three other Churches. It is expected to close because no-one goes to it. The bird and insect population has declined with the disappearance of hedges. The wild flowers have declined with verge and field spraying.
